author: sky.cactus

In my experience, the disagreement comes largely from two things:
1. Whether you care about CPU utilization, disk space, or network bandwidth.
2. What you believe the target hardware is for running an Ethereum client.

author: sky.cactus
content:
The people who say "we can 10x" usually only look at CPU utilization and consider the target hardware to be a modern server.
The people who say "we are way past the limit" tend to be looking at disk space and consider an "off-the-shelf consumer laptop from retail store that is also used for other things" to be the target.
